"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is asking about the least important prognostic factor in congenital diaphragmatic hernia. From the provided documents, pulmonary function is an important prognostic factor, with a PO2 higher than 230 and PCO2 lower than 70 indicating excellent prognosis. Gestational age at diagnosis is also mentioned as a factor affecting outcome, with earlier diagnosis being associated with poorer outcome. However, none of these factors are directly related to the given choices.

The document on congenital posterolateral diaphragmatic hernia past infancy mentions that underdevelopment of left-sided cardiac structures was found to be a helpful prognostic factor. The document on prognosis in fetal diaphragmatic hernia also mentions that associated chromosomal anomalies were found in two fetuses and major congenital heart disease in nine.

In the given choices, pulmonary hypertension is not mentioned as a relevant factor in any of the documents. Delay in emergent surgery is likely to be an important factor affecting outcome, but it is not specifically stated as the least important factor. Size of defect is also not mentioned as a specific prognostic factor, although it may be related to the severity of symptoms.
